climbs.name: Rough Rider
climbs.fa: Bolted and FA by Jeff Roads; 2016

content.description: Start on the right side of the brown pillar and pass a double roof system on the left side of the roofs. Continue up a crack and face on excellent brown stone. Shares anchors with Bully Pulpit.

climbs.name: Rastaman
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2018

content.description: After a loose start, this route improves.  Climb the big corner to the anchors.

climbs.name: Homo Erectus
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description: Climb a left facing corner to an extremely difficult mantle. Easier and fun climbing leads to the anchors.

climbs.name: Caveman
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2016

content.description: An obvious off-width climb that is more fun than it looks.

climbs.name: Bully Pulpit
climbs.fa: Bolted and FA by Jeff Roads; 2016

content.description: Start on the left side of a brown pillar and work up to a tan face and shallow right facing corner.  Continue up the crack to a brown face and the anchors.

climbs.name: AstroBear
climbs.fa: Bolted and FA by Andrew Thaller; 2016

content.description: This prominent line is on the pillar/buttress between JR’s Place and Send Town.  Climb up steep rock to a large andinteresting hueco feature.  Exit the hueco out left to excellent brown rock on crimpy moves. Continue to a ledge and follow fun but easier terrain to the top.

climbs.name: Astro Poodle
climbs.fa: Bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle; 2017

content.description: Start 15 feet right of Astro Bear and climb up large steep blocks. Continue up to the pointy top of a large flake. Move up and left to a ledge. Continue up the steep terrain on decent rock to the top of the Astro Bear Pillar.
